name: encounter_id
description: The "encounter_id" field uniquely identifies an encounter within a healthcare system. It is crucial for linking related data across different systems and ensuring continuity of care. This identifier is typically a string and must be unique within the context of the system. It plays a vital role in data exchange and interoperability, allowing systems to accurately reference and retrieve encounter details. Proper management of encounter IDs is essential for maintaining data integrity and supporting clinical workflows.

name: lastupdated
description: The "lastupdated" field indicates the most recent date and time when the encounter record was modified. This timestamp is essential for data synchronization and version control, ensuring that systems are working with the latest information. It helps in tracking changes over time and is crucial for audit purposes. In FHIR, this is typically represented as a timestamp with timezone, providing precise temporal context for the encounter data.

name: hl7_message_date_time
description: The "hl7_message_date_time" field captures the date and time when the HL7 message related to the encounter was generated. This field is important for understanding the sequence of events and ensuring timely processing of messages. It is typically represented as a string in a standard date-time format. Accurate recording of this timestamp is crucial for interoperability, as it helps in aligning data exchanges across different systems and maintaining the integrity of the communication process.

name: hl7_message_date_time_UTC
description: The "hl7_message_date_time_UTC" field represents the date and time of the HL7 message in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). This timestamp is critical for ensuring consistent time representation across different time zones, facilitating global interoperability. It helps in accurately sequencing events and is essential for systems that operate in multiple regions. By using UTC, this field eliminates ambiguity in time representation, supporting precise data exchange and analysis.

name: hl7_message_control_id
description: The "hl7_message_control_id" field is a unique identifier for an HL7 message, used to track and manage message exchanges. This string identifier is crucial for ensuring message integrity and preventing duplication. It allows systems to acknowledge receipt and process messages accurately. In the context of FHIR, it supports reliable communication between systems, enabling effective data exchange and coordination of care. Proper management of control IDs is essential for maintaining the consistency and reliability of HL7 messaging.

name: meta_latest_source_date_time
description: The "meta_latest_source_date_time" field indicates the most recent date and time when the source data for the encounter was updated. This string field is important for understanding the currency of the data and ensuring that the most up-to-date information is being used. It plays a key role in data validation and synchronization, helping to maintain data accuracy and reliability across systems. Accurate tracking of source updates is essential for effective data management and decision-making.

name: intermediate_snapshot_creation_date_time
description: The "intermediate_snapshot_creation_date_time" field captures the date and time when an intermediate snapshot of the encounter data was created. This string field is important for version control and data recovery, allowing systems to track changes and revert to previous states if necessary. It supports data integrity and consistency, providing a temporal reference for the snapshot. Accurate recording of this timestamp is crucial for maintaining the reliability and traceability of encounter data throughout its lifecycle.

name: final_fhir_write_date_time
description: The "final_fhir_write_date_time" field represents the date and time when the encounter data was last written to the FHIR server. This string field is crucial for ensuring that the most recent data is available for retrieval and use. It plays a key role in data synchronization and version control, helping to maintain the accuracy and currency of the data. Proper management of this timestamp is essential for supporting reliable data exchange and interoperability in healthcare systems.

name: final_fhir_commit_date_time
description: The "final_fhir_commit_date_time" field indicates the date and time when the encounter data was committed to the FHIR server. This timestamp is critical for ensuring data integrity and consistency, marking the point at which the data becomes part of the official record. It supports audit trails and version control, providing a reliable reference for data changes. Accurate recording of this timestamp is essential for maintaining the trustworthiness and reliability of the FHIR data repository.

name: encounter_version_id
description: The "encounter_version_id" field is a unique identifier for a specific version of an encounter record. This string field is crucial for version control, allowing systems to track changes and manage different iterations of the encounter data. It supports data integrity and consistency, enabling accurate retrieval and comparison of encounter versions. Proper management of version IDs is essential for maintaining the reliability and traceability of encounter data, supporting effective data governance and decision-making.

name: version_id_fingerprint
description: The "version_id_fingerprint" field is a unique identifier used to track the version of the FHIR resource. It ensures data integrity and consistency by allowing systems to detect changes or updates to the resource. This field is crucial for maintaining accurate records and supporting version control in healthcare data management.

name: consent_coid
description: The "consent_coid" field represents a unique identifier for a patient's consent document. It is essential for managing patient privacy and ensuring that healthcare providers have the necessary permissions to access and share patient information. This field supports compliance with legal and regulatory requirements regarding patient consent.

name: meta_action_code
description: The "meta_action_code" field indicates the type of action performed on the FHIR resource, such as create, update, or delete. It is vital for auditing and tracking changes to healthcare data, ensuring that all modifications are properly documented and traceable for accountability and data governance.

name: hl7_v2_source_interface
description: The "hl7_v2_source_interface" field identifies the source system or interface from which the HL7 v2 message originated. This information is crucial for interoperability, allowing systems to trace the origin of data and ensuring seamless integration and communication between different healthcare systems.

name: patient_account_num
description: The "patient_account_num" field is a unique identifier assigned to a patient's account within a healthcare facility. It is used for billing, financial tracking, and administrative purposes, ensuring that all services and charges are accurately associated with the correct patient account.

name: patient_primary_id
description: The "patient_primary_id" field represents the primary identifier for a patient within a healthcare system. It is crucial for accurately linking patient records across different systems and ensuring that healthcare providers have access to the correct patient information for clinical decision-making and care coordination.

name: network_mnemonic
description: The "network_mnemonic" field is a shorthand identifier for a healthcare network or organization. It facilitates the identification and differentiation of various networks within a larger healthcare system, supporting efficient data exchange and collaboration among different entities.

name: medical_record_num
description: The "medical_record_num" field is a unique identifier for a patient's medical record within a healthcare facility. It is essential for accessing and managing patient health information, ensuring that healthcare providers can retrieve and update patient records accurately and efficiently.

name: coid
description: The "coid" field represents a unique identifier for a clinical object or entity within a healthcare system. It is used to track and manage specific clinical data elements, supporting accurate data retrieval and integration across different healthcare applications and systems.

name: facility_mnemonic
description: The "facility_mnemonic" field is a shorthand identifier for a healthcare facility. It is used to quickly reference and differentiate facilities within a healthcare network, supporting efficient communication and data exchange between different locations and entities.

name: fhir_visit_status
description: The "fhir_visit_status" field in a FHIR Encounter resource indicates the current status of the encounter, such as planned, in-progress, or completed. It is crucial for understanding the stage of the encounter and for managing workflows. This field helps in tracking patient care, resource allocation, and operational efficiency. It is typically represented as a codeable concept, allowing for standardized status representation across systems. Accurate status tracking is essential for clinical decision-making and reporting.

name: fhir_patient_class_code
description: The "fhir_patient_class_code" field represents the classification of the patient within the healthcare setting, such as inpatient, outpatient, or emergency. This classification is vital for determining the type of care provided, resource allocation, and billing processes. It is typically coded to ensure consistency and interoperability across systems. Understanding patient class is essential for operational management, financial processes, and ensuring appropriate care delivery.

name: fhir_patient_class_display
description: The "fhir_patient_class_display" field provides a human-readable representation of the patient class code, such as 'Inpatient' or 'Outpatient'. This display text is useful for clinicians and administrative staff to quickly understand the patient's classification without needing to interpret codes. It enhances usability and communication within healthcare systems, ensuring that the patient class is easily understood by all stakeholders involved in patient care and management.

name: patient_type
description: The "patient_type" field categorizes the patient based on specific criteria, such as new or established patient, or based on the type of care they are receiving. This classification aids in tailoring care plans, managing resources, and optimizing patient flow. It is important for clinical documentation, billing, and operational efficiency. Understanding patient type helps in delivering personalized care and ensuring that healthcare services are aligned with patient needs.

name: admission_type
description: The "admission_type" field indicates the nature of the patient's admission, such as elective, emergency, or urgent. This information is crucial for prioritizing care, managing hospital resources, and planning treatment strategies. It impacts clinical workflows, billing processes, and operational planning. Accurate admission type classification is essential for ensuring timely and appropriate care delivery, as well as for meeting regulatory and reporting requirements.

name: patient_class_code
description: The "patient_class_code" field denotes the classification of the patient within the healthcare system, such as inpatient, outpatient, or emergency. This code is essential for determining the care setting, resource allocation, and billing processes. It ensures consistency and interoperability across healthcare systems. Understanding patient class is crucial for operational management, financial processes, and ensuring that patients receive the appropriate level of care.

name: account_status_code
description: The "account_status_code" field represents the current status of the patient's account, such as active, inactive, or closed. This status is important for financial management, billing processes, and ensuring accurate record-keeping. It helps in tracking the financial aspects of patient care and ensuring that all services are appropriately billed and reimbursed. Accurate account status tracking is essential for maintaining financial health and compliance within healthcare organizations.

name: vip_indicator_code
description: The "vip_indicator_code" field identifies whether a patient is considered a VIP (Very Important Person) within the healthcare setting. This designation may affect the level of service provided, privacy considerations, and resource allocation. It is important for ensuring that VIP patients receive appropriate attention and care while maintaining confidentiality and security. Accurate VIP identification helps in managing patient expectations and delivering personalized care.

name: financial_class_code
description: The "financial_class_code" field categorizes the patient's financial responsibility or insurance coverage, such as self-pay, private insurance, or government program. This classification is crucial for billing, reimbursement, and financial planning. It helps in determining the patient's financial obligations and ensuring that services are billed correctly. Understanding financial class is essential for managing revenue cycles and ensuring that healthcare organizations remain financially sustainable.

name: mode_of_arrival_code
description: The "mode_of_arrival_code" field indicates how the patient arrived at the healthcare facility, such as by ambulance, walk-in, or referral. This information is important for understanding the context of the encounter, planning care, and managing resources. It can impact triage decisions, resource allocation, and operational workflows. Accurate documentation of the mode of arrival helps in optimizing patient flow and ensuring that patients receive timely and appropriate care.

name: accommodation_code
description: The "accommodation_code" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the specific type of accommodation provided to the patient during the encounter. This could include codes for different types of hospital rooms or wards. It is crucial for resource allocation, billing, and understanding the level of care provided. Accurate coding ensures proper reimbursement and helps in analyzing healthcare delivery patterns.

name: accommodation_code_category
description: The "accommodation_code_category" field categorizes the type of accommodation provided during an encounter. It groups similar accommodation types for easier analysis and reporting. This categorization aids in resource management, financial planning, and quality assessment by providing a broader view of accommodation types used in patient care.

name: hospital_service_type_code
description: The "hospital_service_type_code" field identifies the specific type of service provided during the encounter, such as surgical, medical, or emergency services. This code is essential for clinical documentation, billing, and operational management. It helps in understanding the nature of services rendered and supports accurate reimbursement and resource allocation.

name: hospital_service_type_text
description: The "hospital_service_type_text" field provides a textual description of the service type offered during the encounter. It complements the coded information by offering a human-readable explanation, aiding in clinical documentation and communication among healthcare providers. This field enhances understanding and clarity in patient records.

name: admit_source_code
description: The "admit_source_code" field indicates the source from which the patient was admitted to the healthcare facility, such as a referral from a physician or transfer from another hospital. This information is vital for understanding patient flow, resource planning, and analyzing admission patterns. It also plays a role in reimbursement and care coordination.

name: discharge_disposition
description: The "discharge_disposition" field describes the patient's status and destination upon discharge from the encounter. It includes codes and display text indicating whether the patient was discharged home, transferred to another facility, or deceased. This information is crucial for care continuity, resource management, and quality assessment.

name: patient_id
description: The "patient_id" field uniquely identifies the patient involved in the encounter. It is a critical element for linking the encounter to the patient's medical record, ensuring accurate documentation, and facilitating continuity of care. This identifier supports interoperability and data exchange across healthcare systems.

name: appointment_id
description: The "appointment_id" field links the encounter to a specific appointment, if applicable. This connection is important for tracking patient visits, managing schedules, and ensuring that care is delivered as planned. It aids in operational efficiency and enhances the coordination of care services.

name: account_id
description: The "account_id" field associates the encounter with a specific financial account, facilitating billing and reimbursement processes. It ensures that charges are accurately linked to the correct patient account, supporting financial management and reporting within healthcare organizations.

name: deceased_date_time
description: The "deceased_date_time" field records the date and time of a patient's death, if applicable, during the encounter. This information is crucial for clinical documentation, legal reporting, and care coordination. It also impacts quality metrics and supports bereavement care planning.

name: admission_date
description: The "admission_date" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the date and time when the patient was officially admitted to the healthcare facility. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically represented as a dateTime data type in FHIR, which includes date, time, and timezone. Clinical Significance: Marks the start of the encounter, crucial for determining the duration and for clinical and operational purposes. Billing and Reimbursement: Essential for accurate billing and reimbursement calculations. Clinical Documentation: Used to document the patient's admission time for continuity of care and medical record keeping. Quality Improvement: Can be used to analyze admission patterns and improve patient flow. Relationship to Encounter Period: The "admission_date" is closely related to the period element of the Encounter resource, which defines the overall timeframe of the encounter. The period.start should generally align with the admission_date.

name: discharge_date
description: The "discharge_date" field in a FHIR Encounter resource represents the date and time when the patient was officially discharged from the encounter. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically represented as an instant data type in FHIR, which is a date and time with timezone. Clinical Significance: Marks the end of the encounter, crucial for determining the duration and for various clinical and operational purposes. Billing and Reimbursement: Essential for accurate billing and reimbursement calculations. Clinical Documentation: Used to document the patient's discharge time for continuity of care and medical record keeping. Quality Improvement: Can be used to analyze length of stay, identify potential delays, and improve patient flow. Relationship to Encounter Period: The "discharge_date" is closely related to the period element of the Encounter resource, which defines the overall timeframe of the encounter. The period.end should generally align with the discharge_date.

name: is_valid_date_ind
description: The "is_valid_date_ind" field is a boolean indicator used to validate the correctness of date fields within the FHIR Encounter resource. Key Considerations: Data Type: Boolean, representing true or false. Clinical Significance: Ensures data integrity by confirming that date fields such as admission_date and discharge_date are valid and correctly formatted. Data Quality: Helps in identifying and rectifying erroneous or missing date entries, which is crucial for accurate clinical documentation and reporting. Operational Use: Can be used in data validation processes to flag records that require further review or correction. Special Considerations: This field does not exist in standard FHIR resources but may be used in custom implementations to enhance data quality assurance.

name: alt_admission_date_time
description: The "alt_admission_date_time" field represents an alternative date and time for the patient's admission, potentially used for reconciliation or comparison with the primary admission_date. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically a string representing a dateTime, including date, time, and timezone. Clinical Significance: May be used to capture different time zones or formats from various systems, ensuring comprehensive data capture. Data Reconciliation: Useful in scenarios where multiple systems provide admission data, aiding in data consistency checks. Special Considerations: This field is not part of the standard FHIR Encounter resource but may be included in custom implementations to address specific interoperability or data integration needs.

name: hl7_admission_date_time
description: The "hl7_admission_date_time" field captures the admission date and time as represented in HL7 messaging standards. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically a string formatted according to HL7 standards, which may include date, time, and timezone. Interoperability: Facilitates data exchange between systems using HL7 messages, ensuring consistent and accurate admission data transfer. Clinical Significance: Ensures that admission data is accurately captured and communicated across different healthcare systems. Data Integration: Useful for systems that rely on HL7 messaging for data exchange, ensuring compatibility and data integrity. Special Considerations: This field is not part of the standard FHIR Encounter resource but may be included in custom implementations to support HL7-based data exchange.

name: alt_discharge_date_time
description: The "alt_discharge_date_time" field represents an alternative date and time for the patient's discharge, potentially used for reconciliation or comparison with the primary discharge_date. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically a string representing a dateTime, including date, time, and timezone. Clinical Significance: May be used to capture different time zones or formats from various systems, ensuring comprehensive data capture. Data Reconciliation: Useful in scenarios where multiple systems provide discharge data, aiding in data consistency checks. Special Considerations: This field is not part of the standard FHIR Encounter resource but may be included in custom implementations to address specific interoperability or data integration needs.

name: hl7_discharge_date_time
description: The "hl7_discharge_date_time" field captures the discharge date and time as represented in HL7 messaging standards. Key Considerations: Data Type: Typically a string formatted according to HL7 standards, which may include date, time, and timezone. Interoperability: Facilitates data exchange between systems using HL7 messages, ensuring consistent and accurate discharge data transfer. Clinical Significance: Ensures that discharge data is accurately captured and communicated across different healthcare systems. Data Integration: Useful for systems that rely on HL7 messaging for data exchange, ensuring compatibility and data integrity. Special Considerations: This field is not part of the standard FHIR Encounter resource but may be included in custom implementations to support HL7-based data exchange.

name: reason_for_visit_text
description: The "reason_for_visit_text" field captures the textual description of the reason for the patient's visit or encounter. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, allowing for free-text entry. Clinical Significance: Provides context for the encounter, aiding in clinical decision-making and documentation. Patient Communication: Helps in understanding the patient's perspective and expectations for the visit. Data Analysis: Can be used for qualitative analysis of visit reasons, identifying trends and patterns in patient care. Special Considerations: While this field provides valuable context, it may lack standardization, making it less suitable for automated processing compared to coded data.

name: mt_reason_for_visit_code
description: The "mt_reason_for_visit_code" field captures the coded representation of the reason for the patient's visit, using a standardized coding system. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, typically representing a code from a standardized terminology such as SNOMED CT or ICD. Clinical Significance: Provides a standardized way to document the reason for the encounter, facilitating interoperability and data exchange. Data Analysis: Enables quantitative analysis of visit reasons, supporting research and quality improvement initiatives. Billing and Reimbursement: Essential for accurate billing and reimbursement processes. Special Considerations: The use of standardized codes enhances data consistency and interoperability but requires accurate coding practices.

name: patient_location
description: The "patient_location" field captures information about the patient's location(s) during the encounter. Key Considerations: Data Type: A repeated record, allowing for multiple location entries. Clinical Significance: Provides context for the encounter, indicating where the patient was located at different times. Operational Use: Useful for tracking patient movement within a facility, supporting resource allocation and patient flow management. Data Analysis: Can be used to analyze patterns in patient location and movement, identifying areas for operational improvement. Special Considerations: Accurate location data is crucial for effective patient management and care coordination.

name: location_id
description: The "location_id" field within the patient_location record represents a unique identifier for a specific location where the patient was during the encounter. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, typically representing a unique identifier. Clinical Significance: Identifies the specific location, aiding in clinical documentation and care coordination. Operational Use: Supports tracking of patient movement and resource allocation within a healthcare facility. Data Integration: Facilitates interoperability by providing a consistent identifier for locations across systems. Special Considerations: Ensuring unique and consistent location identifiers is crucial for accurate data integration and analysis.

name: mnemonic
description: The "mnemonic" field within the patient_location record provides a shorthand or abbreviated representation of the location's name or identifier. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, allowing for a concise representation. Clinical Significance: Offers a quick reference to the location, aiding in clinical communication and documentation. Operational Use: Useful for staff and system interfaces where space is limited or quick identification is needed. Data Consistency: Ensures that the mnemonic is consistently used across systems to avoid confusion. Special Considerations: While mnemonics provide convenience, they should be standardized to prevent misinterpretation.

name: physical_type
description: The "physical_type" field within the patient_location record describes the physical type or nature of the location, such as a room, ward, or department. Key Considerations: Data Type: String, representing the type of location. Clinical Significance: Provides context for the encounter, indicating the nature of the location where care was provided. Operational Use: Supports resource allocation and facility management by categorizing locations. Data Analysis: Can be used to analyze patterns in patient location types, identifying areas for operational improvement. Special Considerations: Consistent categorization of physical types is important for accurate data analysis and reporting.

name: emergency_department
description: The 'emergency_department' record encapsulates details specific to the patient's encounter in the emergency department, including arrival, triage, and departure information.

fields.name: edm_arrived_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_arrived_date_time' field captures the exact date and time when the patient arrived at the emergency department. This timestamp is crucial for tracking the patient's journey and calculating wait times. It is typically represented as a dateTime data type in FHIR, including the timezone.

fields.name: edm_triaged_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_triaged_date_time' field records the date and time when the patient was triaged in the emergency department. This is a key point in the patient's care timeline, used to assess the urgency of their condition and prioritize treatment. It is represented as a dateTime data type in FHIR.

fields.name: edm_departure_date_time
fields.description: The 'edm_departure_date_time' field indicates the date and time when the patient departed from the emergency department. This information is vital for understanding the duration of the encounter and for operational metrics such as length of stay. It is typically a dateTime data type in FHIR.

fields.name: coid
fields.description: The 'coid' field represents a unique identifier for the encounter or visit in the emergency department. This identifier is essential for linking related records and ensuring data integrity across systems.

fields.name: priority_rank
fields.description: The 'priority_rank' field indicates the assigned priority level of the patient's case in the emergency department. This ranking helps in managing patient flow and resource allocation based on the severity of conditions.

fields.name: priority_code
fields.description: The 'priority_code' field provides a coded representation of the patient's priority level in the emergency department. This code is used for standardized communication and documentation of triage decisions.

fields.name: priority_text
fields.description: The 'priority_text' field offers a textual description of the patient's priority level in the emergency department. This description complements the priority code and provides additional context for clinical decision-making.

fields.name: edm_reason_for_visit_code
fields.description: The 'edm_reason_for_visit_code' field captures a coded reason for the patient's visit to the emergency department. This code is crucial for clinical documentation, billing, and statistical analysis of visit patterns.

fields.name: edm_reason_for_visit_text
fields.description: The 'edm_reason_for_visit_text' field provides a textual description of the reason for the patient's visit to the emergency department. This description aids in understanding the patient's presenting complaint and complements the coded reason.

fields.name: departure_info
fields.description: The 'departure_info' record contains details about the patient's departure from the emergency department, including disposition and condition at discharge.

fields.name: departure_disposition_code
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_code' field captures a coded representation of the patient's disposition upon leaving the emergency department. This code is important for discharge planning and continuity of care.

fields.name: departure_disposition_text
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_text' field provides a textual description of the patient's disposition upon departure from the emergency department. This description offers additional context to the coded disposition.

fields.name: departure_disposition_display
fields.description: The 'departure_disposition_display' field presents a user-friendly display of the patient's disposition upon leaving the emergency department. This display is used in user interfaces and reports.

fields.name: departure_condition_code
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_code' field captures a coded representation of the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. This code is used for clinical documentation and quality metrics.

fields.name: departure_condition_text
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_text' field provides a textual description of the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. This description complements the coded condition.

fields.name: departure_condition_display
fields.description: The 'departure_condition_display' field presents a user-friendly display of the patient's condition at the time of departure from the emergency department. This display is used in user interfaces and reports.

fields.name: departure_comments
fields.description: The 'departure_comments' field allows for additional comments or notes regarding the patient's departure from the emergency department. This field is used for capturing any relevant information not covered by other fields.

fields.name: patient_location
fields.description: The 'patient_location' record details the patient's location within the emergency department, including treatment and reserved rooms.

fields.name: treatment_room
fields.description: The 'treatment_room' record specifies the room where the patient received treatment in the emergency department, including room code and text.

fields.name: room_code
fields.description: The 'room_code' field provides a coded identifier for the treatment room where the patient was located in the emergency department. This code is used for tracking and managing room assignments.

fields.name: room_text
fields.description: The 'room_text' field offers a textual description of the treatment room where the patient was located in the emergency department. This description complements the room code.

fields.name: edm_location
fields.description: The 'edm_location' record specifies the general location of the patient within the emergency department, including location code and text.

fields.name: location_code
fields.description: The 'location_code' field provides a coded identifier for the patient's location within the emergency department. This code is used for tracking and managing patient flow.

fields.name: location_text
fields.description: The 'location_text' field offers a textual description of the patient's location within the emergency department. This description complements the location code.

fields.name: reserved_room
fields.description: The 'reserved_room' record specifies any room reserved for the patient in the emergency department, including room code and text.

fields.name: room_code
fields.description: The 'room_code' field provides a coded identifier for any reserved room for the patient in the emergency department. This code is used for managing room reservations.

fields.name: room_text
fields.description: The 'room_text' field offers a textual description of any reserved room for the patient in the emergency department. This description complements the room code.

fields.name: edm_transport
fields.description: The 'edm_transport' record contains details about the patient's transport to or from the emergency department, including transport company and ID.

fields.name: transport_company_code
fields.description: The 'transport_company_code' field captures a coded identifier for the transport company involved in the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. This code is used for logistics and billing purposes.

fields.name: transport_company_display
fields.description: The 'transport_company_display' field provides a user-friendly display of the transport company involved in the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. This display is used in user interfaces and reports.

fields.name: transport_id_code
fields.description: The 'transport_id_code' field captures a coded identifier for the specific transport vehicle or service used for the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. This code is used for tracking and documentation.

fields.name: transport_id_display
fields.description: The 'transport_id_display' field provides a user-friendly display of the specific transport vehicle or service used for the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. This display is used in user interfaces and reports.

fields.name: transport_call_date_time
fields.description: The 'transport_call_date_time' field records the date and time when the transport was called for the patient's transfer to or from the emergency department. This timestamp is crucial for logistics and coordination.

name: registration_query
description: The 'registration_query' record contains information about queries made during the patient's registration process, including mnemonic, question, and response.

fields.name: mnemonic
fields.description: The 'mnemonic' field provides a shorthand or code used to identify a specific query or question during the patient's registration process. This code is used for efficient data entry and retrieval.

fields.name: question
fields.description: The 'question' field contains the text of a specific query or question asked during the patient's registration process. This field is used for capturing patient information and preferences.

fields.name: response
fields.description: The 'response' field records the patient's answer or response to a specific query or question during the registration process. This information is used for clinical and administrative purposes.

name: insert_timestamp
description: The 'insert_timestamp' field captures the exact date and time when the record was inserted into the system. This timestamp is crucial for data integrity, auditing, and tracking changes over time.
